text:
Q: How can I delete all lines that contain a specific string from a text file? A:

Here is an sd-based solution:

sd "^.*${pattern}.*\n?" "" <file>

For example, if the input is:

apple
banana
apple like banana

The command is:

sd "^.*apple.*\n?" "" test.txt

The output will be:

banana

Q: How to disambiguate a column in a WHERE clause after JOINing a table with an identical column name in CodeIgniter A:

Your column ambiguity failure will be resolved if you render a JOIN clause with a USING condition. This will "collapse" or disambiguate the offending column in your WHERE clause. There will be no need to prefix your column name with a specific table.

return $this->db
    ->join('group', 'groupid')
    ->get_where('enduser', ['groupid' => $id])
    ->result();

Q: Crystal Reports - Could not load file or assembly 'CrystalDecisions.ReportAppServer.Controllers' A:

Hit the same problem myself deploying to Windows Server 2016

if installing the MS c++ runtime doesn't help you, this is what I did:

On DEV Machine

  • Uninstall Crystal for Visual Studio
  • uninstall Crystal x64 runtime
  • Reboot
  • Install dot net 4.7.2
  • Install Microsoft Windows Update KB2999226
  • Install Crystal for Visual Studio (includes x64 Runtime) (V26)
  • Fix Crystal References (13.0.4000.0) in reports and calling pages
  • Rebuild app and publish

On Webserver

  • Install Crystal x32 runtime (V26)
  • Install Crystal x64 runtime (V26)
  • Install the MS c++ runtime
  • Push New published site to Web Sever
  • Remove Crystal Report assembly references from Web.config <-- responsible for the " The system cannot find the file specified." error
  • Reboot Azure Server
